name: Pan-Fried Turkey Burgers
author: FrackFamily5 CA—>CT
summary: Too cold out to grill? No grill? No problem. These are tasty turkey burgers pan-fried on the stovetop. The secret is to only flip them once. And don't go for the super lean turkey. You'll want a little bit of fat to make them juicy. Top with your favorite cheese and garnishes. Serve on your choice of bun or lettuce wrap and enjoy.
ingredients: ¼ teaspoon garlic salt, divided, or to taste
directions: Grate shallot with a medium plane of a grater into a large bowl
Be sure to collect the juice
Add turkey, mayonnaise, steak sauce, and parsley
Mix gently with your hands until fully incorporated
Divide into 4 equal portions and gently form into patties
Season tops with garlic salt and pepper
Spray a large skillet with cooking spray and place over medium-high heat
When the pan is hot, place in burgers, seasoned-sides down
Season the opposite sides with more garlic salt and pepper
Flip; continue to cook until no longer pink, 4 to 5 minutes more
